Article Title: PSG goalkeeper Safonov has fractured hand after penalty shootout heroics
Article Text:
PSG's goalkeeper Matvey Safonov stop a ball in the penalty shootout during the FIFA Intercontinental Cup final soccer match between Flamengo and Paris Saint-Germain in Doha, Qatar, Wednesday, Dec. 17, 2025. (AP)

PARIS: Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Matvey Safonov has been left with a fractured hand following his penalty shootout heroics to win the Intercontinental Cup.Safonov made four straight penalty saves as PSG beat Brazil's Flamengo 2-1 in the shootout on Wednesday to secure the club's first global title. He was thrown in the air by his teammates during the celebrations.PSG said Friday that Safonov has a fracture in his left hand and that “his situation will be re-evaluated” after three or four weeks.“I can’t explain anything, it’s incredible. The player doesn’t know how it happened,” coach Luis Enrique said in translated comments Friday.He added that the most plausible explanation seemed to be that Safonov was hurt during the shootout and kept playing with the fracture.In a video posted on social media app Telegram, Safonov didn't address what happened directly, but said: “You know, no matter what happens, I can't be broken.”Safonov, PSG’s Russian backup goalkeeper, hadn’t played a single minute for the team until summer signing Lucas Chevalier sustained an ankle injury which has ruled him out since his last game Nov. 29.Chevalier was on the bench against Flamengo. PSG's next game is a French Cup meeting Saturday with fifth-tier Vendee Fontenay.
Article Summary: Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Matvey Safonov has been left with a fractured hand following his penalty shootout heroics to win the Intercontinental Cup. PSG beat Brazil's Flamengo 2-1 in the shootout on Wednesday to secure the club's first global title.

Article Title: Indian Football: ISL clubs asked to submit proposal regarding consortium; women's league to be held without sponsor
Article Text:
Indian Super League trophy (ISL Photo)

NEW DELHI: The Indian Super League (ISL) clubs were on Thursday asked to submit a proposal for forming a consortium to run the 2025-26 season of the league, which is yet to begin.Representatives of all ISL clubs were invited to attend the Annual General Meeting of the All India Football Federation on Saturday, on the sidelines of which the matter was discussed.“Regarding the consortium thing, the clubs have been told to submit to the ministry their proposal so that it can be discussed during the Dec 20 AGM. But there is no guarantee,” a club representative told news agency PTI.The request followed a virtual meeting on Thursday between AIFF officials, ISL club representatives and the sports ministry. The clubs were asked to submit their proposal by Friday evening.The AIFF also informed the clubs that, under its new constitution, any amendment to its provisions could be done only after the General Body of the national federation was formed according to the new constitution itself.“It could be hotchpotch also since the new National Sports Grievance Act is likely to be implemented shortly. So there can be changes under the Act also,” a source in the know of things said.Meanwhile, the Indian Women’s League, starting December 20, will be held without a sponsor after the AIFF and Capri Sports – the lone bidder in the national federation’s tender to monetise the commercial rights of the first and second divisions of the IWL for five years – could not reach an agreement.The clubs had earlier suggested forming a consortium to resolve the ongoing commercial impasse in Indian football.The AIFF said this would require deliberations and approval by its Executive Committee and the AGM.The Marketing Rights Agreement between the AIFF and Football Sports Development Limited, which organised the ISL for 12 seasons since its inception in 2014, ended on December 8, leaving the top-tier league without a commercial framework.
Article Summary: Indian Super League (ISL) clubs were on Thursday asked to submit a proposal for forming a consortium to run the 2025-26 season of the league, which is yet to begin. All ISL clubs were invited to attend the Annual General Meeting of the All India Football Federation on Saturday, on the sidelines of which the matter was discussed.

Article Title: December 18 Throwback: When Lionel Messi lifted FIFA World Cup for Argentina — and finally touched immortality
Article Text:
Lionel Messi of Argentina lifts the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 Trophy (Photo by Dan Mullan/Getty Images)

From Kolkata Chaos to Delhi Celebration: Lionel Messi’s G.O.A.T India Tour At A Glance

A dream eluded for years

Lionel Messi of Argentina's jersey (Photo by Marcelo Endelli/Getty Images)

One final test: Lionel Messi vs Kylian Mbappé

Lionel Messi of Argentina is chased by from Kylian Mbappe of France (Photo by Alex Pantling/Getty Images)

Tears, release and a moment frozen in time

Lionel Messi of Argentina (Photo by Matthias Hangst/Getty Images)

NEW DELHI: Today is December 18. For some, it is just another day on the way to Christmas and the New Year. For football fans, however, it is a date that will forever live in the sport’s collective memory as the night Lionel Messi completed the game.Under the bright lights of Lusail Stadium in Qatar three years back, Argentina defeated France in a final that felt less like a match and more like destiny unfolding in real time.For Messi, it was not just a World Cup title; it was the closing chapter of a lifelong pursuit that had defined his career, his country, and an entire generation of football fans.For nearly two decades, Messi’s greatness had been measured against an absence.He had won everything at club level, from Champions League to multiple Ballon d’Ors, league titles and goal-scoring records that once seemed untouchable.And yet, the World Cup remained the one prize that eluded him, the yardstick by which football immortality is often judged.In Argentina, where Diego Maradona ’s shadow still loomed large, that absence was felt more sharply than anywhere else.Qatar 2022 began with doubt rather than certainty. Argentina’s shocking opening defeat to Saudi Arabia threatened to derail the campaign before it truly began.For a brief moment, old fears resurfaced: was this another World Cup destined to end in heartbreak for Messi?But what followed was a team and a captain refusing to surrender to narrative or pressure.Messi led with calm authority. He scored, he created, he inspired, and, perhaps most importantly, he believed.From the group stages to the knockout rounds, Argentina grew stronger with each game, feeding off Messi’s composure and clarity. Against Australia, the Netherlands, and Croatia, he was not just a playmaker but the emotional compass of the side, guiding younger teammates through moments of chaos and tension.Then came the final: Argentina versus France, Messi versus Kylian Mbappé, experience versus explosive youth. It was billed as a passing-of-the-torch moment, but Messi was not ready to hand anything over.He scored from the penalty spot to give Argentina the lead and later added a second, arriving in the box with perfect timing to finish off a flowing move. At 2–0, it seemed as though the dream was finally within reach.Football, however, rarely allows fairy tales to unfold without resistance. In a breathtaking twist, Mbappé struck twice in the space of minutes to drag France back into the contest.Extra time followed, and Messi once again stepped up, poking the ball home to make it 3–2. Still, France refused to yield. Mbappé completed his hat-trick from the penalty spot, forcing a shootout that felt almost unbearable in its tension.As penalties loomed, the weight of history hung heavy. Argentina had been here before. It was close, but not close enough. This time, though, the script was different.Emiliano Martínez produced heroics in goal, Argentine penalties were struck with conviction, and when Gonzalo Montiel converted the decisive kick, Messi dropped to his knees, overcome with emotion.Tears flowed freely.Teammates swarmed him. In that moment, the burden he had carried for so long seemed to lift. The image of Messi, draped in the black bisht as he raised the World Cup trophy, became instantly iconic.For Argentina, the victory healed old wounds. It united generations that had debated Messi’s place in the pantheon and finally allowed him to be celebrated without caveats.For Messi himself, it was redemption, validation, and closure all at once.He had not just won a World Cup; he had done so as the undisputed leader of the team, delivering when it mattered most.Two years on, the significance of that night has only grown.December 18 is no longer just a date on the football calendar. It is the day Lionel Messi stepped beyond comparison, beyond debate, and into footballing eternity; World Cup in hand, legacy complete.
Article Summary: Lionel Messi won the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 trophy on December 18, 2013. Argentina defeated France in a final that felt less like a match and more like destiny unfolding in real time. For Messi, it was not just a World Cup title; it was the closing chapter of a lifelong pursuit.

Article Title: Detroit Lions QB Jared Goff’s wife Christen reveals how motherhood inspired a complete makeover of both family homes
Article Text:
Jared Goff wife (Instagram and Getty Images)

Jared Goff ’s wife, Christen, creates two homes with one heart



Jared Goff’s wife, Christen, stepped into motherhood with the same intention she brings to every part of her life. Since welcoming daughter Romy, her days have been shaped by movement between two cities, two homes, and one new priority. While her husband leads the Detroit Lions on the field, Christen has been quietly redefining what home means during one of the biggest transitions of her life.Life now unfolds between Los Angeles and Michigan, places tied deeply to the couple’s journey. One carries the rhythm of the ocean, the other the warmth of Midwest winters. With a newborn in tow, those spaces needed to feel safe, calm, and deeply personal. Christen approached that challenge not as a checklist, but as an emotional reset that reflects who they are becoming as a family.For Christen, adapting both houses meant honoring their personalities while making room for Romy. She openly admits she is learning as she goes, sharing, “We’re so lucky to be able to live in two different places.” In California, where she grew up, the home leans into light and air. “I grew up in California, and there, we live by the beach, so our house kind of reflects that,” she says. “We live steps away from the ocean so our house definitely has more of a coastal feel, very indoor-outdoor, which we love.Michigan tells a different story. “And then here in Michigan, our house is a little bit more cozy, kind of farmhouse country. We always have the fireplace going, even in the summer, which is kind of insane, but I would say that this house is so cozy and it just makes me want to cuddle up on the couch and watch a movie.” Each space now includes a nursery that mirrors its surroundings. “In L.A., it’s, like, boho, Bohemian,” she explains. “We have some fun antiques in there.” Michigan’s nursery leans softer. “And then this one is a little more classy,” she says. “Her nursery is so sweet here. It's very, like, muted pink tones. I went full into the girly pink.”As the holidays approach, Michigan will host Romy’s first Christmas. “We are here in Michigan through this season, so we're here, we'll be celebrating here, which is great,” Christen says, adding, “I love a California Christmas by the beach, but nothing beats a fireplace rolling with snow outside and your Christmas tree lit.”Behind the scenes, motherhood has brought exhaustion and joy in equal measure. “I feel like it's a roller coaster a bit,” she admits. Laundry piles up, routines shift, and patience gets tested. Still, perspective grounds her. “My key is chipping away day by day at everything,” she explains. “Just doing what you can and giving yourself grace.”In this season, Christen has found belonging in a new circle. “I feel like I'm part of this new club of women and we all have something in common,” she says. “Moms are superheroes.”Also Read: Travis Hunter’s wife Leanna turns heads in chic white bikini selfie during family birthday celebration

The Kansas City Chiefs heiress moved into the limelight at Turning Point USA AmericaFest 2025 and had moments that transcended fashion or photo-lay. Gracie Hunt attends AmericaFest in support of Erika Kirk

The most recent public appearance by Gracie Hunt has been a combination of politics, pop culture, and pro sports that immediately made headlines online. At Turning Point USA, the Kansas City Chiefs heiress was in the limelight in their AmericaFest 2025 event, where she had more than just a fashion scene or a photo op moment.Her appearance was an indicator of individual belief, collective identification, and an expanding power that goes way beyond the NFL universe. The only thing that increased the popularity of the moment was the unplanned encounter with WNBA star Sophie Cunningham, making an ordinary Instagram interaction a trending cross over event.Hunt attended the multi-day conservative youth conference in Phoenix, posting photos in a neutral-toned outfit while reflecting on the experience. In her caption, she wrote, “Grateful for a powerful few days celebrating faith, freedom, and this incredible country we call home. 🇺🇸🤍 ‘Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord.’ — Psalm 33:12.”Among the many reactions, Indiana Fever guard Sophie Cunningham dropped two fire emojis, prompting Hunt’s warm reply: “Right back at you Beautiful!” The brief exchange resonated because it linked two women from very different sports worlds, reinforcing how shared values often create unexpected connections.Hunt’s recent remarks that she is in favor of a more family-friendly approach to the halftime of the Super Bowl also drew a lot of attention. “I really respect Erika for all that she’s done, especially with creating a halftime show for America,” Kirk said on Nov. 19, via “The Will Cain Show,” she said.Hunt also shared her thoughts that future halftime performers should reflect the NFL’s values. “That football is the attraction and that it didn’t need to compromise its character or rely on cheap appeal to draw an audience, especially when that approach can alienate so much of the fan base,” Hunt said.Also Read: Erika Kirk pulls Taylor Swift into a fresh controversy after viral funeral comments spark backlash while Travis Kelce ignores the drama

Article Title: “Blood’s coming down…”: Taylor Swift reveals the painful injury she hid from fans and backstage chaos with Travis Kelce by her side
Article Text:
Taylor Swift revealed in The End of an Era docuseries that she suffered a bloody knee and hand injury backstage during the Eras Tour but still made it onstage without missing a cue. Despite bleeding and hobbling through quick costume changes, Swift pushed through intense backstage chaos, later joking off the injury as fans spotted it days later.

How Taylor Swift pushed through injury and chaos without missing a beat

Taylor Swift has constructed her Eras Tour as one of accuracy, endurance, and emotional attachment but beyond the perfect shows was a dose of physical roughness that fans hardly noticed. During her The End of an Era docuseries, Swift at last discusses a backstage accident that caused her to bleed and limp only moments before her next appearance onstage.Still, Swift didn't let the painful mishap prevent her from heading back to the stage just in time for the next song to begin. Although the moment went unnoticed on stage, Swifties did notice it a few days later.In Episode 3 of The End of an Era docuseries, Swift recalls tripping while racing backstage between eras. “I remember one time I was running from the ‘Evermore’ era. I trip over the hem of my dress, bust my knee, I skid the palm of my hand off, hobble into the quick change room.”She continued, “Blood’s coming down my hand, I’m changing into the ‘Reputation’ bodysuit, the skin that’s flapping off I just pull it off, more blood. They don’t have a Band-Aid back there. (I) wasn't late for the intro of that song.”She further added that although fans didn't notice her bruise on stage, they later found out a few days later."They're like, 'Oh, her palm's gone.' I was like, 'I'm not acknowledging this. What? Nothing's wrong. It's always been like that.’”Swift acknowledged the injury in a 2023 Instagram post. She wrote,“PS for those asking how I cut my hand, I’m totally fine and it was my fault completely tripped on my dress hem and fell in the dark backstage while running to a quick change braced my fall with my palm. It was all very Mercury in retrograde coded. Don’t worry about me I’m gooooood.”The documentary also reveals the intense logistics behind the tour. Swift nearly had 20 outfit changes per show, which she had to do in between 40 seconds. Andrea Swift even addressed it saying, "Those quick changes are like nothing you've ever seen before. It is like watching a Nascar race.”The Disney+ docuseries also showed Swift and Kelce sharing a long hug and a kiss in a quiet corner behind the stage.Also Read: “The losses affect Taylor”: Travis Kelce’s season-ending loss forces Taylor Swift into an emotional reality check
Article Summary: Taylor Swift revealed in The End of an Era docuseries that she suffered a bloody knee and hand injury backstage during the Eras Tour. Despite bleeding and hobbling through quick costume changes, Swift pushed through intense backstage chaos. She later joked off the injury as fans spotted it days later.

Article Title: “We just wanted different things”: Gisele Bündchen says her divorce from Tom Brady was about far more than his NFL return
Article Text:
Gisele Bündchen clarified that Tom Brady's return to the NFL was not the sole reason for their divorce, stating it was a complex issue of growing apart. She emphasized that personal growth and differing life desires led to their split after 16 years together. Bündchen has since moved on and remarried, while Brady remains focused on his children.

Gisele Bündchen says her split with Tom Brady was about growth and not football

In October 2022, at the time when Tom Brady and Gisele Bundchen finalized their divorce, the media began to focus the discourse on a single explanation that was headline friendly, that is football. The evaluation of Brady rejoining the NFL and ending his retirement was thought to be the tipping point. But, Bündchen herself pushed back the theory in a candid interview with Vanity Fair.At present, Bündchen has completely moved on from Brady and has also recently tied the knot to her Joaquim Valante. However, on the other hand, Brady appears to be still enjoying his single life and being a dad to his children.In a 2023 interview with Vanity Fair, Bündchen was clear that Brady’s return to the Tampa Bay Buccaneers was not the real reason behind their split. She noted that the reasons for the divorce were far more complex.Bündchen said, "Wow, people really made it about that. What's been said is one piece of a much bigger puzzle. It's not so black and white... Sometimes you grow together; sometimes you grow apart. When I was 26 years old and he was 29 years old, we met, we wanted a family, we wanted things together. As time goes by, we realize that we just wanted different things, and now we have a choice to make.”She further added, "That doesn't mean you don't love the person. It just means that in order for you to be authentic and truly live the life that you want to live, you have to have somebody who can meet you in the middle, right? It's a dance. It's a balance.”Brady and Bündchen got married in 2009 and spent a total of 16 years together before getting divorced. Together, they are parents to son Benjamin Rein, 16, and daughter Vivian Lake, 13, and Brady is also a dad to son John "Jack" Edward Thomas with his ex-girlfriend, Bridget Moynahan.Bündchen and Valente, who began dating in June 2023, welcomed a baby boy together earlier this year. A source previously confirmed her pregnancy to PEOPLE in October 2024.Also Read: “I don’t wanna be alive”: Tom Brady’s posts spark fan concern over his mental health after Gisele Bündchen marries Joaquim Valente
Article Summary: Gisele Bündchen says her split with Tom Brady was about growth and not football. She emphasized that personal growth and differing life desires led to their split after 16 years together. She has since moved on and remarried, while Brady remains focused on his children.

Article Title: Did Andrea Swift really hate Joe Alwyn? Swifties analyze her warm Travis Kelce comments in the Eras Tour documentary
Article Text:
Swifties are buzzing after The Eras Tour — The End of an Era documentary highlighted Andrea Swift’s glowing praise of Travis Kelce, which many fans see as subtle shade toward Joe Alwyn. Andrea’s matchmaking story and comments urging Taylor to “do something different,” alongside Taylor’s candid breakup reflections, have reignited online debate about her past relationships.

Andrea Swift gushes over Travis Kelce in new documentary

The new Eras Tour documentary by Taylor Swift is causing a new wave of debate online, and this time around, the focus is not on Taylor and her love life, but her mom. When Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour - The End of an Era unleashed new episodes, fans became fascinated by the open-minded commentary of Andrea Swift, especially her gushing about Travis Kelce To Swifties, the comparison was dramatic. The tender, even protective way Andrea speaks of Kelce and her advice to Taylor to do something different has been construed as the unofficial sentence against her previous relationships.In the documentary, Andrea recounts how headlines about Travis Kelce attending Taylor’s show caught her attention, leading her to quietly vet him through family.Andrea said, “I’m looking at the headlines … and I see that this guy came to your show, and he brought a friendship bracelet and wants to meet you,” and after calling her cousin Robin to vet him, she was told, “Oh my God, he is the nicest guy! And you know what? He really loves his mom.”Andrea later advised Swift “ to start doing something different” and described Kelce's gestures as “so earnest” and “the sweetest thing in the world.” Before Swift's romance with Kelce, she had a short fling with Matty Healy. And prior to that, she was in a long-time relationship with Joe Alwyn.In the Eras Tour documentary, Andrea insists Swift, "You gotta do something different," which fans have interpreted as her subtle disapproval of Alwyn.While she sounded not so pleased with Swift's past partners, she was seen gushing about Kelce.“He really is one of the happiest people I think I’ve ever met, which I adore. He just brought a lot of happiness, which is, I think, what he does in a lot of his circles; he brings a lot of happiness to the room,” Andrea said about the Chiefs' TE.Swift also openly discussed the challenges she faced with her past relationships. “Relationships on tour has always been something I’ve really struggled with because it’s always felt like the tour was taking away from the relationship,” she said. “Somehow, I was not able to do both and feel like I was nurturing both at the same time, even though I would try and try and try and try.”The pair is planning to tie the knot on June 13, 2026, according to Page Six. The number 13 is significant for Swift, as it’s her lucky number.Also Read: “The losses affect Taylor”: Travis Kelce’s season-ending loss forces Taylor Swift into an emotional reality check

The tender, even protective way Andrea speaks of Kelce and her advice to Taylor to do something different has been construed as the unofficial sentence against her previous relationships.

Article Title: Will Patrick Mahomes play against Tennessee Titans today? Latest injury update on Kansas City Chiefs' star QB
Article Text:
Will Patrick Mahomes play against Tennessee Titans today? (Getty Images)

Will Patrick Mahomes play against Tennessee Titans today?



Already eliminated from the playoff race, Kansas City Chiefs will face Tennessee Titans on Sunday. Arrowhead silence is rare in December, but this season has forced Kansas City into unfamiliar territory. What was expected to be another late-year surge instead unraveled with startling speed. Injuries piled up, early warning signs became permanent cracks, and the league’s most reliable problem-solving machine finally stalled. Now, as the Chiefs head to Nashville, the focus has shifted from postseason positioning to pride, evaluation, and survival.Sunday’s game at Nissan Stadium was once framed as a marquee clash, a glimpse into the NFL’s present and future. Fans expected to watch Patrick Mahomes test himself against Tennessee’s top pick Cam Ward. Instead, the matchup arrives stripped of its star power, reshaped by injury and disappointment, and heavy with the weight of what might have been.No, Patrick Mahomes will not suit up against the Titans. His season ended abruptly last week when he suffered a torn ACL and LCL in his left knee, an injury that slammed the door on Kansas City’s playoff hopes and altered the franchise’s immediate future. Surgery followed quickly, performed Monday in Dallas by Dr. Dan Cooper of the Carrell Clinic. Team officials confirmed Mahomes will begin rehabilitation right away.The timeline ahead carries both caution and optimism. If recovery progresses smoothly, Mahomes could be back early in the 2026 regular season. A slower path may push his return closer to November, but the Chiefs remain confident in his long-term outlook. For now, Gardner Minshew is expected to start under center, beginning with the Week 16 road trip to Tennessee.This absence marks a sharp break from routine. For the first time since 2014, Kansas City will watch the NFL playoffs from home. A decade of dominance ended not with a dramatic collapse, but with a quiet realization that answers were running out. Defensive issues lingered from the opener. A loss in Jacksonville hinted at trouble. Then injuries turned strain into surrender.Still, the Chiefs are not approaching Sunday as a formality. Andy Reid made that clear while addressing Tennessee’s resilience and physicality.“They’re playing good football,” said Reid, “particularly on the defensive side with that defensive front. They’ve got a heck of a defensive front. Mike’s done a nice job of taking over as the interim. He’s had a lot of experience as a head coach, so he knows how to handle a role like that. He’s done a nice job of keeping the guys going and playing hard.”With three games left, Kansas City’s goal is simple. Finish with purpose. Evaluate honestly. And wait for the return of the quarterback who defines the franchise.Also Read: Patrick Mahomes surprises Chiefs teammates with early Christmas gifts despite his own injury struggles
Article Summary: Patrick Mahomes will not play against Tennessee Titans on Sunday. Mahomes suffered a torn ACL and LCL in his left knee last week. Gardner Minshew is expected to start under center, beginning with the Week 16 road trip to Tennessee.

Article Title: NBA injury update: Clippers’ 28-year-old center will miss several games following Grade 2 ankle sprain
Article Text:
Ivica Zubac. Image via: Getty Images

NBA injury update: Ivica Zubac timeline and details



Clippers must adjust without Ivica Zubac



The Los Angeles Clippers finally had a reason to smile after a rare home win, but the relief did not last long. Late in the first quarter against the Lakers, Ivica Zubac went down hard, clutching his left ankle as the arena fell quiet. He tried to gather himself, but the limp toward the locker room told the story before any report arrived.By Sunday, the NBA injury update delivered clarity and concern. Zubac will miss several weeks after being diagnosed with a Grade 2 left ankle sprain. As the Clippers are already searching for stability, losing their most reliable interior presence will have a major impact in the weeks ahead.The injury occurred during Saturday’s 103-88 win when Ivica Zubac landed on LeBron James’ foot while attempting a shot near the elbow. He stayed on the floor as play continued, then exited for evaluation and never returned. At the time, Zubac had five points and two rebounds in 11 minutes.ESPN’s Shams Charania reported the diagnosis on Sunday. He shared that the absence will stretch multiple weeks. The Clippers later confirmed Zubac will be reevaluated in three weeks, leaving no firm return date. The setback interrupts one of the strongest stretches of Zubac’s career.The 28-year-old is averaging 15.6 points, 11.1 rebounds, and 2.5 assists while shooting 60.9 percent from the field.Lakers center Jaxson Hayes showered praise for the Clippers center. “Zu is a dog, man,” Hayes said. “He's, honestly, I feel like one of the most slept-on bigs in the league, man. If you play him, you know he's like that. Zu has been like that for years.”Zubac’s absence lands at a difficult point in the schedule. The Clippers sit near the bottom of the Western Conference after a long stretch of losses, even with Saturday’s win snapping a home drought that dated back to October.Kawhi Leonard’s season-high 32 points lifted the team against the Lakers, but the challenge now shifts to sustaining progress without their defensive anchor.Brook Lopez is expected to slide into the starting lineup while Tyronn Lue experiments with rotations behind him. Zubac leads the team in rebounds and blocks, ranks among the top scorers, and provides structure on both ends of the floor. His durability had been a constant until now, with six straight seasons of heavy availability entering this year.As the Clippers prepare for upcoming matchups, including a meeting with the Houston Rockets, the focus turns to survival and adaptability. The hope inside the organization is that rest and time will bring Zubac back before the season slips further.Also Read: Why NBA punish David Adelman? Denver Nuggets head coach hit with a massive 35K penalty
Article Summary: Ivica Zubac will miss several weeks after being diagnosed with a Grade 2 left ankle sprain. The injury occurred during Saturday’s 103-88 win against the Lakers. Zubac is averaging 15.6 points, 11.1 rebounds, and 2.5 assists this season.
